text: When I was involved in a traffic accident.
label: fear

label: shame

text: I feel guilty when when I realize that I consider material thingsmore important than caring for my relatives.I feel veryself-centered.

text: When I was tired and unmotivated, I shouted at my girlfriend andand brought up negative sides of her character which are actuallynot so important.
label: shame

text: When I think that I do not study enough.After the weekend Ithink that I should have been able to have accomplishedsomething during that time.
label: guilt

text: When I pass an examination which I did not think I did well.

label: joy

label: sadness

label: fear

text: When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.

text: When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.

label: shame

text: It was winter/spring and the ice was melting.I was far out on ajetty and I poked the ice with a long branch to try and break it. The branch went through the ice and I fell in, the water closedin over my head.
label: fear

text: Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, bysomeone close to me.

text: Failing an examination.

label: anger

text: When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and Iam shut up in my appartment.Nothing happens in particularbecause there is no time for anything else.
label: sadness

text: When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killinggoing on in the world.

text: I lied, to be precise I cancelled a meeting with a good friend.
label: shame

text: When one lets friends down
label: guilt

text: When I was accepted for a course on finance and accounting.
label: joy

text: A bus drove over my right leg.The event itself was not veryfrightening but when I had to wait in the emergency ward forthree hours and then my leg began to swell, I was frightened.
label: fear

text: At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I hadto learn all on my own.
label: anger

text: When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.
label: sadness

text: When I had just moved into my new appartment I found a ventilatorin the kitchen.I was going to clean it when I found that thedrum was full of mud and slime.I felt disgusted.
label: disgust

label: guilt

label: anger

text: Railway station good-bye.
label: sadness

text: I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy.He wasprobably an imposter.
label: disgust

text: I told a friend that I was going to a party and he would notenjoy himself if he came along.He understoodthat he would nothave fitted in and there was something in that.
label: shame

text: I was the reason behind the break-up of my friend's relationshipwith his girlfriend.She finished with him.
label: guilt

text: I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.
label: joy

text: On the way back from Denmark with a friend on a small yatch,there was a storm and my friend was blown overboard;I was veryscared till I managed to get him back onboard.

text: I found some worms in the food and I had obviously eaten some.

text: My friend was so intoxicated that the police came and took himaway, and they later contacted his parents.

text: I hapened to overhear something which I was not meant to hear.

text: When I am out in the dark and a suspicious looking charactercomes towards me.
label: fear

label: joy

text: On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the caracquaplanned.I lost contact with the road surface for a fewseconds.

label: anger

label: sadness

label: anger

text: When I dropped a bottle in the state liquor store and everybobystarted laughing.

label: joy

text: When I could not find my 2 year old daughter.I ran and lookedfor her everywhere and could not find her.(I finally found her,she had gone to bed to sleep)

text: When friends try to put me down or hurt me.
label: anger

text: Marriage crises.Boredom.
label: sadness

text: When someone makes advances that one does not want.

text: When my boyfriend went away for a month long holiday without me.
label: anger

text: Last year when I worked during the Summer holidays and studiedat the same time for an examination I had to repeat; my boyfriendwent to Greece for a holiday for a month.
label: sadness

text: When a dog is left whining outside a shop.
label: disgust

text: When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keepthe promise.

text: When I realized that I had three more examinations to take.
label: guilt

label: joy

text: At a restaurant I observed how the gypsies tried to get money bycheating the foreigners i.e non Swedish speaking.My anger hadnothing to do with hatred against foreigners, but it was anexpression of the anger I feel when I see people being used .
label: anger

text: At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encounteringproblems one can not manage.Thoughts revolve around failingthe subject and the consequences it would have for the future.
label: sadness

text: While walking in town I noticed how the police harrassed a manwho was under the influence of alcohol.They terrified him withthe thought of arrest by driving close behind him on a pedestrianstreet.My disgust was directed at the gestures and the facialexpressions of the policemen; they seemed to be enjoyingthemselves.
label: disgust

text: When my boyfriend revealed that he knew that I had discoveredthings of an important nature about him, I felt ashamed as I hadnot mentioned it earlier.
label: shame

text: When I am dishonest to a friend to whom I am very close.Ifeel guilty because I know that he gives a different version ofthe truth and I have not corrected these mistakes, and he isaware that I know that they are wrong.
label: guilt

text: When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by amargin of three marks.
label: joy

text: When my father was ill and was waiting for the results of his tests.

text: When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did nothave a raincoat on me.
label: anger

text: When I failed an exam.
label: sadness

text: At a Sm√∑rgasbord table, a man mixed differnet kinds of pickedherrings with fruit salad.
label: disgust

text: When I had not prepared my contribution to the group asthoroughly as the other members, with the result that theoverall result was poor.
label: shame

text: When my father and I worked on the house just after he hadrecovered from illness, I was rather lazy.This meant that hehad to work hard and was not very well later.
label: guilt

text: When I found out that my father had lung cancer and they did notknow how long he would live.
label: fear

text: When a colleague asked me for help at work, despite the factthat he had more time to do it than I had.

text: When I did not get the salary increase that I had been expectingand understood how little one's work was appreciated.
label: sadness

text: When I met a friend whom I had not seen for a long time andheard all about her troubles, I thought that I should have gotin touch with her earlier.
label: shame

text: I got angry at my mother for something trivial.We were in abad mood because my father was very ill and I knew that my motherreally needed support.I had reacted wrongly.
label: guilt

text: New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.We stood on thesteps outside her parents home and I kissed her for thefirst time.
label: joy

text: A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer. Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.
label: sadness

text: When I saw a picture, in the Gothenburg Post, of a totallydemolished car with two fatally injured passengers.The car wasso badly damaged that they couldn't get the bodies out at thescene of the accident.
label: disgust

text: One night I had a sexual intercourse with another man.My sexualdesire and my curiosity had made me jump into bed with him.I amashamed of myself now.
label: shame

text: Due to laziness, I failed the term studies completely atUniversity.I also wanted, to some extent, to protest against myparents' expectations.
label: guilt

label: sadness

label: fear

text: I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, thiswas the second time.One had a negative attitude towards thelecturer.
label: anger

text: In the tram there was a fat, sickly looking woman in front of mewho was asking for directions in a thick voice.When she got up togo a disgusting smell of urine came from her.I felt that Iwould choke.
label: disgust

text: When we were at home, my husband and I, he made a remark aboutsomething I had done, in a perfectly friendly manner.My deedhad been unjust and I knew that my husband was right, therefore mysense of shame.
label: shame

text: I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude to men, theway she talked and I compared her to an acquaintance of mine. Later, the same evening, my sister looked sad.I felt guiltyabout her sadness.
label: guilt

text: I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me onmy birthday.
label: joy

text: In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came towake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at thehighest volume into my room - it was the morning service at itsloudest.
label: anger

text: My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as hecould, and once put me in a difficult situation after which Icould not but detest him.
label: disgust

text: Once I arrived two hours late to my work place (a bank) and I wasstill feeling feeble and tired.
label: shame

text: Our association had Polish visitors and when they were going backby boat I did not go to see them off (I am the chairman of theassociation).
label: guilt

text: I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become thevice-chairman of our student organisation.I was reallysurprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind itthere was worry - how shall I succeed ?
label: joy

text: Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list ofnames of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.Weread the names and then each group went its own way to a seminarroom.I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and ifI would succeed as a group leader.
label: fear

text: My grandmother died, and my mother called me one sunday morningin the Autumn.The way my mother told me about it, I hated herat that moment.She sounded as if she had been waiting for thedeath of my grandmother.I had lost a person close to me.Ifelt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late.I had notremained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.
label: sadness

text: At the underground station, a drunkard came to speak to me.Hetried to ask me something but I did not answer so he began tospeak about me with his companion.I detested this dirtygrowling man.
label: disgust

text: I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to bedone in groups of two.I was talking about it to my friends whenI said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning mywork partner.I did not quite mean what I said and I feltashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is alsoa friend of mine.
label: shame

text: I had told my boyfriend that I did not want to go on with ourrelationship.I knew that I was important to him but I wanted tobe free.I saw that this was difficult for him but I remainedfirm and did not change my mind.
label: guilt

text: Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.I had known herfor about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking\the same language\"- meaning an inspiring discussion andencounter."
label: joy

text: [ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me,though I have not in any way been connected to some events.]
label: anger

text: After hearing about the death of my grandfather.First I couldnot believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation washopeless.I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.
label: sadness

text: My little brother was arrested by the police at the railway station afterhe had drunk some beer.
label: shame

text: At my temporary job, I have to restrictothers' actions and makethem obey me, and this very often gives mea feeling of guilt.Iwish there could be some other way of acting.
label: guilt

text: I met a dear friend of mine after a long time.I expressed my feelingsin our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (withcomplete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking thehand of the other person, etc...
label: joy

text: I felt fear of the purest kind after a car accident.Theincident and images of horror kept coming back to my mind.Iwondered what could have happened to my sister, my friend and me,though nothing very serious actually happened.
label: fear

text: Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, howthey had teased a young and shy girl I know.They had despisedher conviction, scorned and touched her.I got very angry anddid not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.
label: anger

text: My sweetheart left me, or rather we decided to break it off bymutual consent.The consequences were - unrestrained weeping,feelings of loneliness, hopelessness and disconsolation.I feltthat I should find a friend, to talk to joyfully and to forget.
label: sadness

label: sadness

label: disgust

label: guilt

text: My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drankan enormous amount of spirit.This was dangerousand he didnot understand that he had done anything wrong.

text: [ Cannot recall any incident when I felt shame.]
label: shame

text: A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.
label: fear

text: The long lasting illness of my grand-mother, and the changes infamily relationships caused by it.
label: sadness

text: Spoilt, smashed and molded potatoes in the fridge, and having toclean up the dish later.
label: disgust

text: A truth expressed unthinkingly at a coffee party.I realizedlater that I had been inconsiderate, at a wrong moment and thewrong place.
label: shame

text: I did not go to the exercises, without any adequate reason.
label: guilt

text: While watching TV (a war movie), I felt a strong fear of death,threat and fear of loosing people close to me.
label: fear

text: I was angry with a friend of mine who behaved in an affectedmanner.
label: anger

text: I made a long-distance call to people rather close to me and Ithought about the sad incident that had happened to them in thenear past; I knew that they were thinking about it too when I madethe call.
label: sadness

text: My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in apeculiar manner.
label: disgust

text: When my friend let my personal matters be publicaly known.
label: shame

text: When I think about my family (parents, brothers, sisters) guiltis a part of my feelings.
label: guilt

text: I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well.( I had not seen her for several months.)
label: joy

text: When one of my cat died of a disease.
label: sadness

text: I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to mystudent lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which hadbeen planned by taking people's comfort into account.
label: disgust

text: My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I broughtanother girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober Ifelt quite ashamed of myself.
label: shame

text: I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question washalf an hour late.
label: anger

text: The death of my grandmother.
label: sadness

text: In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon asI returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a loadon the tractor trailer.
label: disgust

text: On the way back from a Summer spent in Sweden, I drunk with a manin the train.I had drunk so much that when I got home I fellasleep in the entrance hall.I have never drunk that much,neither before nor after that incident.I was ashamed because mymother and my sister had to see me in that state and my fatherhad to carry me to bed.
label: shame

text: While at primary school, I did not let a friend ring a bellalthough he would have liked to do it.Afterwards I felt bad.
label: guilt

text: I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.
label: joy

text: I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, when I sawa man hiding behind a tree.I got frigthened, turned around andran out of the forest.
label: fear

text: I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine.He wascriticizing my earlier conduct towards him, which to my mind wasunfounded.When I reached home, I ran out of the taxi andslammed the door.
label: anger

text: I was travelling in a local train when a drunkard, smellingterribly, entered the same carriage and started eating fish thatwas stinking.
label: disgust

text: I was working as a secretary.My boss was to go to give alecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of theplace.
label: guilt

text: A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.
label: joy

text: Years ago, on my way to school by the forest path I came acrossan exhibitionist.
label: fear

text: A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, andtherefore associated unpleasant traits to me.
label: anger

text: [ A person close to me told me that his positive regard dependedon my conduct.]
label: sadness

text: As a little girl, I was sick in the middle of a school day and Ivomitted in the basin of the classroom.
label: shame

text: I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.
label: guilt

text: I got to know that I had been accepted at university.
label: joy

text: I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.Atnight I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoidswere on the move.
label: fear

text: When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn myother friends and me.
label: disgust

text: It was my turn to cook dinner.I forgot a dish (the favourite ofthe family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.
label: guilt

text: My joy was the joy of meeting again.My husband came home afterhaving been away for weeks (for work).I was on the railwaystation to meet him.
label: joy

text: I was alone at home and I could hear odd noises coming from aboveour bedroom.I knew that nobody lived there since it was anoffice.I got frightened (later I was given a \natural\"explanation)."
label: fear

text: A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to himabout a problem concerning his sister and me.I was angrybecause this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me andinstead spoke to my husband.I got to know about it later thesame day.
label: anger

text: The death of my father, even though we had not been very close toeach other.
label: sadness

text: The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us. I did not like the man.
label: disgust

text: The death of my father made me feel quite guilty, because myattitude towards him had been cold and indifferent.
label: guilt

text: My mother, sister and I were thinking about old times, ourchildhood, and we had a very happy time.
label: joy

text: My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car.At theagreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had anaccident.
label: fear

text: I am a school teacher.One of the classes does not obey me at all,keeps on talking, does no work.One afternoon, everything wentwrong, and I got exceedingly angry.
label: anger

text: A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a fewmonths old.
label: sadness

text: A series about Freud was shown on TV.In it, a tampon had beenset in the nose of a woman, and forgotten there.After greatpain it was taken off (close-up picture), the woman was bleedingfrom the nose and the mouth.
label: disgust

text: I had promised to lend something to my mother-in-law and I forgotit a couple of times.When she asked me about it the third time,I was ashamed at my absent-mindedness.
label: shame

text: A borrowed car broke down while I was using it.It was not myfault, nevertheless I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text: I started a new branch of studies after having failed a formerone.When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to knowthat I almost had full marks.
label: joy

text: My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning somethingwhich was serious and a real burden to me.
label: anger

text: My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.
label: sadness

text: [ The same as in anger.]
label: disgust

text: My girlfriend sent me a letter with a shiny picture in it.
label: joy

text: On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about theincreasing threat of war with the USA.
label: anger

text: My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).
label: sadness

text: Watching a violent movie.
label: disgust

text: The morning after a wild party.
label: shame

text: When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got \very good\"high school graduation marks."
label: joy

text: My grandmother was about to die, and it had the effect that atnight, after having read a book, and once in bed, in perfectdarkness, the fear arose that I too may suddenly die.
label: fear

text: When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had beencareless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessarymistakes concerning things I know and understand.
label: anger

text: When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parentstreated their sons in an unequal manner.The most successful ofthem got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was notencouraged and was rejected.
label: disgust

text: I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents andeducation.I said something and then realized that I did notknow my friend's parents, their motives and education.I feltashamed at having talked about something I did not know anythingabout.
label: shame

text: My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (Ihad torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-dayenveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.
label: guilt

text: I feared that I was pregnant.It was not planned and I wouldhave been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not haveliked at all.Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to knowthat I was not pregnant.
label: fear

text: A member of a religious sect tried to convert me, using reallyevil tricks to persuade me.After he had left, I was anxious andangry for a long time. After the event, I was alone.
label: anger

text: When my boyfriend wanted to leave me, I felt sad and melancholic.
label: sadness

text: In a film, there was an episode where they used a chain saw tocut a man.I could not look at it, but I could not avoidlistening either.I sought shelter in my boyfriend's arms.
label: disgust

text: When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that theboat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun wouldaccidentally go off.
label: fear

text: My father had once again told me that I should be careful and try toseek admission to other places also apart from the faculty ofSocial Sciences at the university of Helsinki.I was not at allinterested in any other place and had no time to study for otherentrance exams.
label: anger

text: I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, butI realized that I was not wanted.I felt hurt, disappointed,lonely and deserted.
label: sadness

text: I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and Itended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener wasamused.
label: shame

text: When I was baby-sitting at my cousin's place, I tried to have apleasant time and did not really take care of the child.I donot care very much about children.
label: guilt

text: When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result wasunexpected and it made me realize that statistics do notsurpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.
label: joy

text: When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented mefrom watching the news.The first feeling I had was that I wasbeing treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.
label: anger

text: [ When after a night of sleeping in another's arms, one wakesalone and knows that the lonely arms of the night are not thesame that one meets in the morning.]
label: sadness

text: When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.Asubtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness andneutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.
label: disgust

text: Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feelashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wantedto say.Thoughtlessness.
label: shame

text: When I behaved improperly - fought in a public place. Afterwards, I felt guilty about my conduct.
label: guilt

text: When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in amoment.
label: joy

text: My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bedat night.
label: fear

text: I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.
label: shame

text: I did not go to help a friend of mine, though she probably neededme.
label: guilt

text: I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fencewhena train was coming.
label: fear

text: I detested my father who was a drunkard.He would rave,threaten and blame my mother and me.He finally drove us awayfrom home.
label: disgust

text: When I was on holiday with my former boyfriend, he hit me andbehaved in a very evil and ugly manner in front of the hotelpersonnel.
label: shame

text: When as a child I stole, from a friend of mine, the ring she hadgot in an easter egg.
label: guilt

text: When I got home from a pleasant trip abroad, I got to know that Ihad been accepted at university.
label: joy

text: At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and thenext day they promised to take revenge on me.
label: fear

text: My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from agood friend who, she thought, was not good company for me. Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried todefend my friend.
label: anger

text: I got to know about the death of a close friend.
label: sadness

text: When I was caught telling a white lie.At that time, I was notallowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.One day when I was late, Imade up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place,though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing withmy pals.
label: shame

text: I am a kindergarten teacher and I am thoroughly weary of my job. After having taken the university entrance exam I suffered fromanxiety for weeks as I did not want to carry on with my work - studieswere the only alternative.
label: fear

text: My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke aboutkicking the cat.He had never done anything of the kind, but Iknew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.
label: anger

text: My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life, old-fashioned values)and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions.I havenoticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems bydrinking.I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.
label: disgust

text: Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.Mylife-partner threw all the books off the shelf.I am sure that itdisturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.
label: shame

text: A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed awish to meet me, I have however avoided her (turned down aninvitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up allmy empathy.
label: guilt

text: Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer andwine.
label: joy

text: A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would neveraccomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.
label: anger

text: I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problemsand failed attempts at reconciliation.My sadness was caused bythe irreversibility of the decision.
label: sadness

text: A man spat on the wall of a house.
label: disgust

text: In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens andinvalids.
label: shame

text: When I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished anonacademic degree.
label: guilt

text: When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understoodsomething about why I exist and what my task in life is.
label: joy

text: At the railway station, while waiting for the last train at nightI noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in apurposeful mannner.
label: fear

text: When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contactwith my parents.
label: sadness

text: When I approached a person of the opposite sex and was rejected.
label: shame

text: When I noticed that my little sister was sulking, because I couldnot meet her because of a misunderstanding.
label: guilt

text: The day I got to know that I would get a shared dwelling with myboyfriend.My parents place was getting a little crowded withmy growing bother wanting a room to himself.I first felt doubt,then joy, but also sadness.The feeling of joy was thestrongest.
label: joy

text: My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed athome.I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost chokedon mucus secretions.
label: fear

text: The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those closeto me.(blaming us and lying)
label: anger

text: A very drunk person.
label: disgust

text: While trying to get my little brother over a ditch, he fell onhis head and started crying.I was scared of having caused himpermanent injury.
label: guilt

text: [ A chat on the telephone with a friend.]
label: joy

text: [ Meeting some new (unpleasant) people or some new, demandingsituation.]
label: fear

text: [ For example, unfair pushing in a bus.]
label: anger

text: [ When I am, in my opinion, not understood correctly. ]
label: sadness

text: [ When some people act very important in any situation.]
label: disgust

text: [ Generally, when I am late in attending to matters (for examplepaying bills).]
label: shame

text: [ If one has planned to do something \important\" and then, forsome reason, fails to do it.]"
label: guilt

text: I was in a dancing-tavern and the atmosphere was one of waitingfor the end of the world.Suddenly people began dancing wildly,inspired by the band.An unbelievable experience : wonderfulthat even Finns sometimes flare up and forget to think \whatothers are thinking of me\".It was delightful to dance to one'sheart content."
label: joy

text: I was at home, filling my tax report.Nobody had time to helpme.I would have liked to do it quickly so that I could go andmeet a friend of mine who had just returned from hospital.I gotangry as both my brother and my father refused to give me their calculatoras I had not asked for it nicely.I could not leave as Ihad to wait for help and the tax report had to be done.
label: anger

text: I tried to talk to my parents over the phone, as I wanted to gohome for the week-end and I knew that I would not be able to bearit.I tried to reduce the gulf and the conflict between us bytalking in order to unite our worlds.Result : hysterical mess,blinding and blaming.
label: sadness

text: My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letteraddressed to me.She denied having read it intentionally andsaid \the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sunwas shining on it\". Hah Hah."
label: disgust

text: When I moved away from home.
label: guilt

text: The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctorsaid that the ear was completely all right.
label: joy

text: My husband suddenly fell ill seriously and during the medicalexaminations we did not know what would follow.
label: fear

text: The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so thatthe inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.
label: anger

text: My child, unexpectedly started acting in a restless anddisturbing way at school.In addition his performance at schoolweakened.
label: sadness

text: On a trip abroad, a lady-like member of our group turned out tobe an alcoholic.She spoilt many days of my holidays because ofher behaviour and paranoia.
label: disgust

text: I had been guilty of gossiping and blaming others, and one of mysuperiors at the workplace made a formal reprimand.
label: guilt

text: When a student of mine (at music) performed and played remarkably well.
label: joy

text: When climbing up the stairs to the top of a ski-jumping hill.
label: fear

text: The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.
label: sadness

text: While watching the movie called \Deer hunter\" on TV, when itshowed how prisoners were treated."
label: disgust

text: When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towardsmy students.
label: guilt

text: While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd ofcows.
label: fear

text: When I heard that my step-mother had treated my mother in a wrongmanner.
label: anger

text: When I heard about the advances an acquaintance of mine had madeto my friends, who did not approve of them.
label: disgust

text: When after having had sexual intercourse with a friend, I thoughtthat he had told about it to a friend of his.
label: shame

text: When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.
label: guilt

text: At night, I walk home past a forest.Once, somebody got stabbedin the forest.I imagine someone attacking me and I hurry up.
label: fear

text: A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.I was sadwhen I realized how easy it is to forget something that one hadonce regarded as great and significant.
label: sadness

text: A nightmare.I was dreaming about bloodsuckers, which I tried toshake off from my body, they are everywhere, they get glued, theysuck.And there are a lot of them.I panic.
label: disgust

text: I told evil lies about a close friend of mine.I was evil inorder to sound jolly, to charm a person whom I wanted to impress. I sold my friend, I was despicable.
label: shame

text: Traveling as the only female in a railway carriage in the middleof the night in Italy.
label: fear

text: A male, Honduran acquaintance of mine despised my opinions.
label: anger

text: When our dog died.
label: sadness

text: While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met anacquaintance of hers.My friend started showing off and tellingfalse stories about herself and praising herself.
label: disgust

text: I was dishonest to my boyfriend concerning something that isimportant to our relationship.
label: shame

text: A parking fine.
label: guilt

text: After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt greatjoy and relief.I had been haunted by the thesis during thewhole of my studies.
label: joy

text: During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interferingwith my tasks and making unfounded remarks.I felt hatred forhim but it stopped when I realized that he just longed for attention.
label: anger

text: The last time I felt sad and disappointed was when I did not doas well as I had hoped in one of the final exams.As comparedwith the earlier exams, the questions, I think, were unjust.
label: sadness

text: After the first of May, I detested my fiance's friends, who hadpiled on to our party and spoilt it completely.
label: disgust

text: At my summer job, I was responsible for making various orders. It was not me who had ordered some seasonal merchandise, but whenmuch of it was left over and had to be thrown away in the Autumn,I felt partly responsible for the much too large order.
label: guilt

text: When I met a good friend of mine after a long time.
label: joy

text: I was camping with a friend of mine and we spent the night in theforest.I could not fall off to sleep and could clearly hearnoises from outside (steps ?) approaching our tent.
label: fear

text: Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finlandfor a year as an exchange student.
label: sadness

text: While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to thelavatory.My cousin told grandma and she came.
label: shame

text: While having a discussion with a colleague of mine, I realized that herconception of man and work were similar to mine.
label: joy

text: While he was drunk, my life partner tried to hit me.I feltscared and fled to the bathroom.
label: fear

text: A \higher status\" colleague of mine despised my attitude andorganization of work."
label: anger

text: I could not meet my love, after having waited for a month, due toillness.
label: sadness

text: Once again, my life partner came back home drunk at midnight.
label: disgust

text: My love and me rented a room in a hotel one evening.We stayedthere a few hours and when leaving the hotel, I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text: [ I had, by being silent, disapproved my love and made himunhappy.He had not been able to keep his promise.I thus wasthinking about my own conduct towards another person.]
label: guilt

text: I had just moved to the town where I study and I got a postcardfrom a good friend (from my home town).
label: joy

text: They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.
label: anger

text: After my boyfriend and I had separated.
label: sadness

text: In the morning, the cat of my landlady had vomited on the floor,near the staircase I take to go to the bathroom.
label: disgust

text: My boyfriend's mother, whom I had not met earlier, made anunexpected visit.I was lying lazily on the bed, reading anewspaper and my boyfriend was studying.
label: shame

text: The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I hadleft open.
label: guilt

text: I got a letter from my best friend, whom I had not heard from fora long time (a good letter).
label: joy

text: Someone knocked on the door when I was alone at home (thoughthere was a door bell).I looked through the peep hole but ithad been covered.I called my sister but she could not help meas she was hundreds of kilometres away.
label: fear

text: My parents put pressure on me to buy clothes, when I would nothave liked to do so.
label: anger

text: When my grandfather died, I saw my grandmother crying against myaunt's shoulder (I had never seen my grandmother cry before).
label: sadness

text: At school, I detested the spinach gruel which had lumps of flourin it.
label: disgust

text: [ I speak harshly to my parents though they only mean my owngood.]
label: guilt

text: When I got a letter from home.
label: joy

text: While cycling in the country a dog started running beside me,growling and barking, and trying to bite my foot.
label: fear

text: Disagreements with mother.When I moved from KankaanpSS, she hadpromised to help me move but broke her promise because of somehindrance.
label: anger

text: When I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me,because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.
label: shame

text: When I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited anddisappointed.
label: guilt

text: I found myself a place after looking for one for a long time.
label: joy

text: [ In an aeroplane.]
label: fear

text: I was angry at my boyfriend who had promised to come to see mebut did not because he spent the evening with his pals.
label: anger

text: The breaking up of a relationship.We decided that therelationship could not carry on, so it was no surprise to me.And anyhow, I had known it would happen sooner or later.
label: sadness

text: The disgust I feel towards a certain person.
label: disgust

text: After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.
label: shame

text: At my job, I got disproportionately angry with a child.Myreaction was not as it should have been.
label: guilt

text: I went to see the entrance examination results at university.Irejoyced at my success.
label: joy

text: I borrowed a car which was supposed to be used for a long journeya few hours later, and one of the tyres burst in the middle ofthe town and I did not know what to do.
label: fear

text: An utterance, which I had intended to be a joke, was taken as anoffence.In my opinion, this was stupid, and I got angry.
label: anger

text: My best friend had a relatively severe illness.I was sadbecause she was suffering.
label: sadness

text: I told my friend about how I had calculated my salary by cheating alittle.When my friend remarked about it, I understood that itwas wrong to do so, and I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text: I am going steady with a boy, but I had sexual intercourse withanother one, and I felt guilty about it afterwards.
label: guilt

text: A good report card (a scholarship) in primary school.
label: joy

text: I was walking home with a friend at night along a quiet street. Something started rustling in the bush : it was an exhibitionist.
label: fear

text: I got angry at a friend of mine whom I caught reading my notebook(almanach).
label: anger

text: When my grandmother died of cancer.
label: sadness

text: In a lift a drunken, fat and untidy man tried to make advances atme.
label: disgust

text: [ Sometimes I have by accident said to another person somethingin which it is easy to read a negative attitude.]
label: shame

text: For the sheer pleasure of it, I quarelled with my boyfriend who was trying to be especially kind to me.
label: guilt

text: When I made the acquaintance of a certain person.
label: joy

text: When my grandfather died.
label: sadness

text: When I was working, I got treated in a way which I felt was notdemocratic.
label: disgust

text: While working as a domestic helper, one day I had not cleaned upvery well and they made a remark about it.
label: shame

text: When I decided to move away from my parent's home, my mother toldme that it was as if a part of her had been torn out of her.
label: guilt

text: When I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice,and his attitude made me glad.
label: joy

text: I was in a restaurant with my boyfriend when I saw my best femalefriend after not seeing her for two weeks.We rejoyced, huggedand had a long talk.
label: joy

text: One evening, while going to meet a friend of mine, I had to crossa meadow by a dark road.There were bushes on the other side ofthe road.The weather was damp and a bit foggy.I heard stepsbehind me and kept speeding up my steps all the time.
label: fear

text: My brother told me that a person (whom I know) had insulted him. I am very fond of my brother, and as he himself can not get angryor hurt, my protectiveness was aroused and I got angry.
label: anger

text: My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.One evening,when I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.My mother'sexpression told me that it had died.My knees refused to supportme and I began to weep convulsively.
label: sadness

text: I happened to see two boys fighting, one of them fell down andhurt his head.The other one used this to spank the head of theboy on the ground.
label: disgust

text: I had not written to, or called my grandmother, who was lonely,for a long time.My mother asked me to call her on her behalfand when I did so, my grandmother was delighted and she told methat she had been waiting for some news from us.
label: guilt

text: When I was sick my husband bought me a piece of cake.
label: joy

text: I saw a man who had had a heart-attack and who was beingtreated for it.I feared that my own father could have beenthere.
label: fear

text: When I saw a big man hit another one, and nobody did anything.
label: anger

text: When my sister left to go home, in Sweden, after the ChristmasHolidays.
label: sadness

text: I once watched the series called \Dynasty\" on TV, and I detestedit."
label: disgust

text: I feel guilty as I am not working, and even my studies are notprogressing.
label: shame

text: A neighbour's girl had disappeared and many people were lookingfor her.Someone had gone to notify the police.Something hadcertainly happened to her.
label: fear

text: Without my permission, my son had made popcorn after coming backfrom school.The consequences were a spoilt kettle and chaos inthe kitchen but what could have happened with the hot grease ?
label: anger

text: The death of a close relative.
label: sadness

text: One of my fellow students used questionable and unfair means toadvance her studies faster than others.I detested her.
label: disgust

text: After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me tobuy a rose for my mother.We went together to a pub and mymother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.Idid not known about it and so was all the more glad.
label: joy

text: I work at a day care centre, and one day when the children wereoutdoors a four-year old boy disappeared from the yard.I wasnot looking after them then, but as the manager it was me who wasresponsible.
label: fear

text: The fact that my mother is getting married again (my mother andfather divorced about 15 years ago) means that she will probablymove to Turku, and our home, which is a one family house, will besold (I myself have not been living at home for the past sixyears).
label: sadness

text: While travelling in a bus, there were three people sitting behindme (two men and a woman).They were drunk and the conversationwas unbelievable (about fucking, fellatio, etc...).They triedto get others to take part in the conversation.I loathed it andfelt like crying.
label: disgust

text: When I was seven years old, I stole a chewing-gum from a bigglass bowl on the counter of a nearby shop, and I got caught.
label: shame

text: I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meetingI forgot to take the minutes.
label: guilt

text: I awoke at night and did not remember dreaming about antthing inparticular.I just felt oppressing fear, it was dark and all theothers were sleeping.
label: fear

text: I was on a class excursion, by boat to Stockholm.At night myclass mates prepared to clebrate their motive in life which was\life is merriment\".I felt depressed about the way they soughthappiness."
label: sadness

text: I was on my way home by bus.A man who had drunk a fair amount ofalcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sittingnext to him.Fortunately it was not me.
label: disgust

text: When, after a long time, I saw a girl with whom I was in love.
label: joy

text: When I was walking on a fairly out-of-the-way street.
label: fear

text: A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for aconcert which I considered important.He could not get them theway he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.
label: anger

text: I heard somebody talk about studies in a highly enthusiastic\student-like\" way."
label: disgust

text: While attending some affairs, which were taking some time, witha bank officer, I felt that my clothes and appearance were out of place, tooraggy.
label: shame

text: While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever and amusing sketch.
label: joy

text: The last day of school is traditionally celebrated by singing asong about all the students who are leaving.In the songabout me, there were things which irritated me a lot.
label: anger

text: I worked for seven months in a factory, and made friends with afellow worker.Later, I visited my former fellow workers and wastold that, while in the army, my friend had shot himself.
label: sadness

text: The behaviour of a fellow towards me and some others in the armywas really mean.I detested this.
label: disgust

text: I tried to date a girl, but she refused.
label: shame

text: While doing some calculation exercises, I neglected a part of it,though I had marked it as done.By chance, I was asked todemonstrate this very part on the blackboard.
label: guilt

text: In the army, my result at the shooting exercises gotme a three day furlough.
label: joy

text: I lead a rather secure life.The only thing I can remember is asong from the nineteenth century which is against alcohol.Boththe melody and the word (although naive) effected my emotions.
label: sadness

text: Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this issomething I just can not tolerate.
label: disgust

text: In primary school I once faltered while answering a question andthe others started laughing.
label: shame

text: [ Generally when I am shopping I feel like I were guilty of allthe thefts through the year (I have never stolen).]
label: guilt

text: While playing a ball game, I was just about to make a goal when Iwas thrown off my feet, and I failed to score the goal.
label: anger

text: When I heard about the death of Frantois Truffaut, the French motion picture director, on the radio.I had planned to go and see hislast film.
label: sadness

text: I saw a movie called \The Thing\", the film directed by JohnCarpenter.The monster in the film made me feel disgusted."
label: disgust

text: When I was in the sauna bath.
label: joy

text: I had a dream in which I was an African elephant.
label: fear

text: When I came for the lesson, it was cancelled and I had to fill ina questionnaire instead.
label: anger

text: When I saw our computer teacher.
label: disgust

text: When I was going downhill on skis, and fell down twice the firsttime.
label: shame

text: I passed an exam which I thought I had failed.
label: joy

text: My mother had not come home at midnight.She had forgotten totell me about it.I was very young and all alone at home.
label: fear

text: My girlfriend started singing (she cannot sing) and did not stopdespite my asking her to do so.
label: anger

text: When I was still a child, I saw a horror film on TV in whichthere was a rotten human skull.
label: disgust

text: As a small boy, I took a coin from an empty taxi cab.My mothersaw it and told the driver about it.I even knew the driver.
label: shame

text: When I betrayed my former girlfriend.
label: guilt

text: New Year's Eve party in the country, I hardly knew a person; mypartner spent most of the time at the bar. I had littleopportunity to get to know people because our table was separatedand my boyfriend's parents were present.
label: anger

text: Christmas Eve: there was a tension between my parents, they didnot even try to restore a harmonic atmosphere. Mother stayed inher room almost the whole day. I felt alone and was very sad.
label: sadness

text: Father said: If you are pregnant, you will have to procureabortion. I was filled with disgust against my father.
label: disgust

text: I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold dayin winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the coldfor half an hour.
label: guilt

text: After one year of searching, my friend and I have found a flat weare able to pay for.
label: joy

text: Car accident in the middle of the night.
label: fear

text: At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of asports event, but my teacher refused to give me the day offbecause he didn't like me.
label: anger

text: When I was six years old, my favourite cat died.
label: sadness

text: I was very fat and felt absolutely unwell. I was afraid ofleaving the house and getting to know new people.
label: shame

text: I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill andgrowing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault untilseveral weeks later.
label: guilt

text: I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informedabout it, I felt joy.
label: joy

text: My sister had to undergo a very complicated operation, hereyesight was at stake.
label: fear

text: I had a quarrel with my parents; I was convinced to be right.
label: anger

text: I heard that a friend had died in an accident; group situation:suddenly a friend came in and said \Have you already heardthat...\"; there was a terrible consternation, silence, theneverybody shouted excitedly \"How could that happen...\"."
label: sadness

text: Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna, three drunkmen thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene fromanother carriage.
label: disgust

text: I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretendedlove and affection to be able to sleep with her.
label: shame

text: A young girl tried to put an end to her life because of lover'sgrief; not until she was in hospital I heard that I had been thereason for her action.
label: guilt

text: A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before,did not pass the final examination and had to take it again halfa year later.
label: sadness

text: There was a time when my room looked terribly untidy; just atthat time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent herfrom entering the room.
label: shame

text: I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop, but I didnot do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraidthat he would grumble.
label: guilt

text: My boyfriend returned after a long absence.
label: joy

text: My car skidded on the wet street.
label: fear

text: I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it andhad certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me,played cards with other people.
label: anger

text: In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playingwith his penis in the middle of the town.
label: disgust

text: Somebody who knows me very well discovered that I had told him alie.
label: shame

text: When my boyfriend was away, I flirted with his best friend; Ifelt guilty the next day.
label: guilt

text: Recently a good friend only called me when he needed something.He never said \please\" or \"thank you\" or any other kind word."
label: anger

text: My favourite horse died. We had tried our best to save him, butit was hopeless, he had to be shot.
label: sadness

text: I read a book about the sexual phantasies of women; I read abouta woman having sexual intercourse with a dog.
label: disgust

text: I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for severalweeks. I watered them, but let them stand in a cold room so thattwo of them perished.
label: guilt

text: When we stayed in Vienna with our class, my friend and I behavedincorrectly. Our teacher threatened us with exclusion fromschool.
label: fear

text: When I lost my driving license because I had been driving whileunder the influence of alcool.
label: anger

text: I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a nightclub.
label: shame

text: During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much. Whenwe went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost hisway. I thought that something must have happened to him (hefinally arrived but after a very long time).
label: guilt

text: My father stayed abroad for one year. He does not like to writeletters because he makes ortographic mistakes. I never had a goodrelation to him. He wrote me a letter in which he said that heloved me.
label: joy

text: A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explainthings as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in anaggressive manner.
label: anger

text: Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his noseand glass-eye, rattling breath.
label: disgust

text: I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell inlove with another man.
label: guilt

text: When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.
label: joy

text: When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in achair.
label: anger

text: A person died (not really a friend).
label: sadness

text: Several weeks ago, I had problems with friends, I felt disgustedby a friend.
label: disgust

text: When quarreling with friends.
label: guilt

text: In Southern Tyrol, I was gathering apples, it was a fine day, Iwas not thinking about anything, I felt an overwhelming joy.
label: joy

text: My girlfriend and I slept in a lonely hut (we had drunk alcool).Suddenly some soil fell on us, then some water. Although we triedhard, we could not find out the cause.
label: fear

text: I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics.Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained andstarted to cry. I grew angry.
label: anger

text: On a trip I passed by a cellulose factory. It was a fine day,beautiful landscape; I observed this factory with disgust.
label: disgust

text: When I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was16). When I entered the sauna naked, I felt ashamed for a shorttime.
label: shame

text: I came home from a discotheque at half past four in the morning,although I had promised my parents to come home at midnight. From3 a.m. I felt guilty towards my parents.
label: guilt

text: On my way through lonely streets I met with a huge stray dog. Itstopped at some distance and looked at me. I tried to ignore itbut I was very frightened.
label: fear

text: A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to actas a model because she felt too tired. It was a quarter of anhour before the appointed time, I had just lied down and did notwant to go because it was too late anyway. She said that I onlywas talking about looking for work, but if it was possible Iwould not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.
label: anger

text: After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for halfa year, I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (foreconomic reasons). We separated although I loved him.
label: sadness

text: In a certain book I read about cruelties and violence in prisonand souteneur circles; I felt especially disgusted when I readdetailed descriptions of physical and mental torture of lesspowerful people.
label: disgust

text: When I talked to a psychotherapist for the first time, I startedto cry; first I talked to him but he did not say anything andafter a while I was crying.
label: shame

text: I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Motheralways told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assistingmy sister in defending herself against mother's interference, Ijust behaved aggressively towards my sister.
label: guilt

text: When I worked as an \au-pair-girl\" in London, I received a callfrom a good friend who told me that she was in London too andwanted to see me. I was very glad - after that call andespecially when I saw her."
label: joy

text: A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and seeme. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town.Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I gotimpatient I called her but her parents told me that she had goneskiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointmentto be able to see her.
label: anger

text: When I was eight years old my father was run over by a car. WhenI saw his body I was sad beyond words.
label: sadness

text: After a terrible quarrel with my family, I withdrew in my room. Ifelt guilty because I had caused this scene by my aggressivebehavior.
label: guilt

text: I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like verymuch.
label: joy

text: I was afraid of a certain examination although I was relativelywell prepared.
label: fear

text: At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my newtrousers. These stains are not removable, so I cannot put on thetrousers again.
label: anger

text: In 1977, my grandfather, to whom I had a very close relationship,died.
label: sadness

text: A drunken man forced me to kiss him.
label: disgust

text: A friend started to insult another person without reason and Ifelt ashamed of her behavior.
label: shame

text: I had to call somebody between 12 and 12:30. As I had nopossibility to call him at this time, I did not do it until 3p.m.
label: guilt

text: After a one year's stay abroad, I returned home. I was even moreglad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.
label: joy

text: I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark, I went veryfast. Behind me, there were some drunk men who shouted at me. Bychance, I met some friends who accompanied me.
label: fear

text: A friend who shares the room with me, opened the window in themorning and left the room the whole day. When I came home in theevening, the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.
label: anger

text: A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as manypeople as possible. He said he first listened to what they saidand then he tried to only say things they would like to hear.He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgustedwhen he told that.
label: disgust

text: After closing the front door I realized that I had left the keyinside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my ownhouse but the house of people I hardly knew.
label: guilt

text: On our way to France, my girlfriend and I went to Verona. Bychance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets forthe dress-rehearsal of \Aida\". It was a different world for usfull of fascination. After the representation we ate a phantasticpizza in a restaurant near the \"Arena\"."
label: joy

text: On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Nearthe house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As mygirlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me.He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but Ireally did not like that.
label: fear

text: I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for somesilly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.
label: anger

text: When I stayed in the house of friends, I washed my face andwanted to dry it with a towel. This towel seemed to have beenused over a long time already. It smelled indefinably awful.
label: disgust

text: A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore, once Istayed with him and his girlfriend, I bought some meat, but nobodywanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said \I thoughtyou wanted to invite us for dinner\". \"Of course\", I said, but Ithought by myself that it must have been enough that I had bought it."
label: shame

text: It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girlbut I considered it only as an \affair\". Only much later I realizedhow painful this must have been for the girl."
label: guilt

text: I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I hadcaused. A third person meddled in our conversation, turned myefforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I hadintended.
label: anger

text: Death of my grandmother.
label: sadness

text: In school I had difficulties mith mathematics. When I had to workfor an examination, I really felt disgusted.
label: disgust

text: One night I did not come home without telling my parents and Idid not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I hada bad conscience and felt guilty.
label: guilt

text: After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.
label: joy

text: One evening, in the tramway, I was afraid of two drunk menmolesting my girlfriend and me.
label: fear

text: When the grandmother of my friend died in a hospital. My friendwas crying and I was sad, too.
label: sadness

text: I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out ofhis mouth while speaking.
label: disgust

text: It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something,but I felt that I was not able to express myself very well - I feltashamed and blushed.
label: shame

text: I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything forme, I was very glad.
label: joy

text: When I was a child, I heard the floor cracking and I thoughtthere was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket andtrembled.
label: fear

text: When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would missthem.
label: sadness

text: During a football game, another player who was perspiring verystrongly ran into me.
label: disgust

text: I tried to pass an examination particularly well, but I did itworse than ever. I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text: During the military service, I lost a part of an equipment; Iaccused another person and he was rebuked and punished.
label: guilt

text: I am a \cantor\" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago Ihad to sing too, but the organist did not tell me in time. As Idid not know the psalm, I was afraid and said that I could notsing."
label: fear

text: During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, hisgirlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to mybrother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my placefor dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if Ihad never asked her.
label: anger

text: Several years ago my brother died in an accident. When I heardabout it, I was very sad. It took years until I resigned myselfto it.
label: sadness

text: I read a book about the situation in South-Africa, about theterrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with thewhite population.
label: disgust

text: My P.T. instructor also works as a masseur. He wanted to massageme, therefore I had to undress. For the first few times this wasnot easy for me; I got gradually used to it.
label: shame

text: Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer thetheoretical questions very well, but I failed the practicaldriving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.
label: guilt

text: When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He hadundergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death.When he came home I could see him smile for the first time aftermay weeks.
label: joy

text: After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath torelax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he hadfinished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.
label: anger

text: I met some nice people during my holdidays. When they left I knewthat I would never see them again.
label: sadness

text: For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off ourclothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to gointo another classroom where older pupils were sitting andstaring at us.
label: shame

text: I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way.My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slappedmy brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.
label: guilt

text: One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk tosomebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.
label: joy

text: My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I saidmean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.
label: anger

text: I watched the news at the TV, it was a commentary about\Hainburg\". I felt disgusted when I heard members of the unionspeak about the situation."
label: disgust

text: A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Onceshe had a child she had a better relationship with them.
label: joy

text: Once our school class went skiing. On a steep slope a boystanding behind me lost his balance, fell down and drew me withhim. I slided down the whole slope. At about 1 m distance from atree I could stop.
label: fear

text: It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble aboutthe young people just because I had not immediately left my seatto them.
label: anger

text: When I was younger I was very good in apparatus gymnastics. Ialways won in competitions, but once I was only at the fourthplace.
label: sadness

text: During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from meoutwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certainhopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him thecircumstances
label: guilt

text: I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I hadnot seen for two years.
label: joy

text: I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house.I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and therewas a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.
label: fear

text: At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to meand nobody mentioned anything about that.
label: anger

text: My little cat which I had raised all by myself, hanged itself whenplaying in the garden.
label: sadness

text: At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to helpanother boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose thewrong things so that he had to repeat a year.
label: disgust

text: When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make herfeel hurt.
label: shame

text: I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontmentbut I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayedholiday job.
label: guilt

text: When I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day when I camehome a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was sofrightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waiteduntil somebody passed by.
label: fear

text: When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he hadbig problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle ofthe night and shouted at me.
label: disgust

text: When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister.Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She criedand shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.
label: guilt

text: After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurriedhome hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feelinghis body.
label: joy

text: One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the groundfloor, I was often afraid of burglers.
label: fear

text: One day, when riding on a bicycle path, a car coming from theopposite direction forced me to get off my bike although I hadthe priority.
label: anger

text: My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainlywould have liked to live longer. I was also said because I wasconfronted with the fact that I would die one day too.
label: sadness

text: One day, when I was twelve years old, my brother took some slimysubstance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made ofcider and threatened to throw it at me.
label: disgust

text: When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I hadtold him that my father had retired.
label: shame

text: I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as Ihad wanted to.
label: guilt

label: fear

label: disgust

text: I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking aboutour problems, I told her lies.

text: My mother had fallen down from a ladder when she had beengathering cherries. Her back was hurt. Just when I arrived, I sawpeople of the life-saving service giving her medical care.
label: fear

text: I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parkingplace, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncomingtraffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placedhis car on the place.
label: anger

text: My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.
label: sadness

text: At a discussion a friend took a \faschistic view\", what I had notexpected."
label: disgust

text: Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop couldnot consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a bigsurprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Ourrelationship grew closer.
label: joy

text: When I was a child, I fell into a cellar (when playing) and couldbe freed only with big difficulties.
label: fear

text: When my grandmother died. I had a very deep relation to her (Ilived with her for several years).
label: sadness

text: Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of mypart. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusinglyshe did not give up for a longer time.
label: disgust

text: When I was parking my car I was not cautious and bumped intoanother car. I caused considerable damage. The driver of theother car was very angry and I let him insult me because I feltguilty.
label: guilt

text: When I was walking on the street, a group of drunk, bawling youngpeople approached.
label: fear

text: When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I wouldhave liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on theletter.
label: anger

text: When my grandmother died.
label: sadness

text: When I wanted to talk to someone I liked and whom I have beentold likes me (by his brother and even by himself) however heavoids any confrontation, and is vague.
label: anger

text: After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot ofsupport and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.
label: sadness

text: When a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing infront of a group of my friends.
label: disgust

text: When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen adoll's dress from my next-door neighbour.
label: shame

text: Feeling guilt after greed, buying chocolate and pigging out tothe point of feeling sick, especially as I am fat.
label: guilt

label: joy

label: fear

label: anger

text: Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped alongby would-bein-laws.
label: sadness

text: No very strong such emotion. Treatment of my sister by herdancing instructor - he is a \user\", i.e., takes advantage of hergood nature."
label: disgust

label: shame

text: Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourthyear twice.
label: guilt

label: joy

text: When boyfriend lied to me.
label: anger

text: When harassed by this boy - it was sexual (refer to GUILT).

text: When in grade 3, late home from school every day for weeksbecause of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to mother aboutwhy I was home late.
label: guilt

text: Getting a part-time job.
label: joy

text: Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of usstarted zig-zagging and so did we. Car in front did a 180¬¶ turn wefollowed and ended up in a gully.
label: fear

text: People hunting animals.
label: anger

text: When my grandfather was sick, and died I felt more sad, though,when he was sick.
label: sadness
