text: For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.
label: joy

text: When I was ringing up a guy who was my teen idol, and was inAuckland. I was really scared, I didn't know what to say or do.
label: fear

text: When my mother decided to clean out my room and throw out whatshe thought was junk, without my knowing about it, so I returnedhome to find half my stuff gone.
label: anger

text: When I couldn't find my dog which was missing.
label: sadness

text: I was disgusted with a friend's behaviour when she got absolutelydrunk so that she vomitted all over my house.
label: disgust

text: I was taking place in an anti nuclear protest and was shoutingprotest loudly to some American sailors of the U.S. Texassubmarine. A guy came up to me and said that's your brotherscreaming at, I felt shame and I realized screaming at anotherperson isn't good protesting. Now I'm a silent protester.
label: shame

text: I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and havingan argument. I was being stubborn and proud, and selfish, becausemy friend let me down, through no fault of her own.
label: guilt

text: When I met my boyfriend and we discovered that we shared the sameideals and goals in life, and that we could share all ourfeelings and thoughts and felt that the world's not so bad whenyou have someone really close to share your life with.
label: joy

text: I had called a boy who had dated me, and told him that I was ill,while, actually, I didn't want to go out with him, later on, he askedme if I was feeling better, then I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text: When I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.
label: fear

text: We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently usedhard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friendsalso used them. While we agreed we would help the big user tostop using it.
label: disgust

text: During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing anear-ring.
label: shame

text: It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy apresent together. However, now I had bought something togetherwith my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.
label: guilt

text: For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.
label: joy

text: I didn't do an important job and it had an adverse effect onother people.
label: shame

text: I stroke a person undeservedly.
label: guilt

text: I felt fear when my mother was heavily ill.
label: fear

text: I felt sadness when I had to get separated from the woman I lovedwho had to leave for her motherland.
label: sadness

text: I felt disgust with the alcohol, after I happened to see a youngman, who was dead to the world and who wallowed on the pavement.This \sight\" I watched from the bus."
label: disgust

text: I felt shame and I couldn't look into my teacher's eyes, afternot attending his lectures.
label: shame

text: I felt guilty after I battered to death a classmate of mine.
label: guilt

text: I was happy when at difficult times I could find support in myfriend and my fiancT, I was happy because of their spiritual andmoral help which gave me new power to struggle. I was happy then,I felt it in my soul.
label: joy

text: My living and working conditions at home were unbearable. We usedto live in a three room flat together with two more families. Thediscords caused a change - one of the families moved out. Theother family stayed with us but I drifted away from my fiancT. Infact we were two families in the flat. Then I found myself alonein the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay nextto me my grief and sorrow took on large proportions. I wanted tocommit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause ofthe irritation.
label: sadness

text: I am disgusted with my sister's husband. On an early Sundaymorning after having knocked at my door, he suddenly rushed inand finching me still in bed he began quarrelling aboutsomething. I could not understand. I heard his last words: \Don't stare at me so because I'll beat you in your bed\" I got up terrified and a thrashing followed."
label: disgust

text: I feel shame mixed with anger with the behavior of someincultivated people because my fiancT is a foreigner.
label: shame

text: I had an accident with a trafic police car that was packed at acurve without any visibility and against all traffic regulationsin a strong snowstorm. As a result I still cannot repair my carbecause of the missing spare parts.
label: anger

text: A sudden doubt made me run for a long time in a rainy autumnnight. When I reached the intended place I saw my beloved inanother man's arms. A sudden blow, grief, I cannot qualify it, itis painful for me to remember about it.
label: sadness

text: I felt disgust with a man I had trusted and respected, to whoseproblems I had always shown deep understanding.
label: disgust

text: I was given the task to learn a page of music text for a smallpart. But I had forgotten all about it and I felt quite awkwardwhen I had to show what I had prepared.
label: shame

text: Some time ago I slapped my son without trying to understand whothe real culprit of a damage was. After that I felt guilty andbad but it was too late.
label: guilt

text: My boyfriend made me a proposal.
label: joy

text: A whole crowd of us went to a folklore festival. The instructorof the cast where my boyfriend played was traveling with us. Wedecided to catch the train that leaved early in the morningbecause we had business on the following day. The instructortried to get the upper hand and made us catch the train in spiteof everything, all the time he made me angry.
label: anger

text: When I quarrelled with my boyfriend.
label: sadness

text: I am disgusted with the fact that bad singers play at the opera(and not only there) only because they are protegTs or lovers ofan important felow while at the same time some young and ablesingers work in a quite different field of life.
label: disgust

text: I feel shy to show all my worth when I work for the first timewith a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.
label: shame

text: I offended my mother.
label: guilt

text: When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination andI realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.
label: joy

text: Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was noone to help me and call First Aid.
label: fear

text: When I was admitted to a Language school. On the day when I wasinformed by a message and my parents congratulated me.
label: joy

text: When diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I feltbreathless. I was cautious but I doubted I should be able to cometo the surface and inhale.
label: fear

text: When my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and beexamined by good experts and she deceived me.
label: anger

text: When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had rememberedabout my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to seethem as soon as possible.
label: sadness

text: I felt it when I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himselfwith high ranking officials.
label: disgust

text: When I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to mymother and when my behaviour had been influenced by other outwardfactors.
label: guilt

text: When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to havebeen right.
label: anger

text: For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel griefwhen you are away from home, too.
label: sadness

text: They wanted something to happen but I didn't.
label: anger

text: I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.
label: sadness

text: I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turnedout to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.
label: disgust

text: My first girlfriend. I had the feeling that she was going outwith me only because of my defect.
label: shame

text: Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.
label: guilt

text: Having passed an exam.
label: joy

text: Having a car accident.
label: fear

text: I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that hehad revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.
label: anger

text: Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.
label: disgust

text: Adultery with a friend's girlfriend.
label: guilt

text: I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and mostof all when we are at a party.
label: joy

text: I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed bythe one comming from the opposite direction at an incrediblysmall distance.
label: fear

text: I get angry with people who attain certain status withoutdeserving it, only with the support, authority and influence ofother people.
label: anger

text: I feel sad when I see things done against men and nothing couldstop it - at least I think so.
label: sadness

text: I have experienced disgust with some people - usually doubledealers.
label: disgust

text: I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical HigherInstitute.
label: joy

text: I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.
label: fear

text: I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deservingit or when someone deceives me.
label: anger

text: I feel disgusted with toadies, hypocrites, chameleons.
label: disgust

text: When I do something unworthy.
label: shame

text: When I offended my parents without wanting it.
label: guilt

text: After each successfully passed exam I am happy.
label: joy

text: A friend of mine gave birth to a child. Very dangerous delivery.I was afraid for her and for the baby.
label: fear

text: I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do,naturally negative. Servility, \connections\", impudence, traits that get me mad."
label: anger

text: My brother is a soldier. He promised to come home in a furloughbut in the last moment he phoned and said that he could not come.
label: sadness

text: I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.
label: disgust

text: Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for -money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.
label: shame

text: When I have been overhastingly offending or hurting.
label: guilt

text: After the term exams I happened to meet a person that I respectand of whom I think very highly. It was nice that although we seeeach other rarely he had not forgotten me.
label: joy

text: I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lostmy confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.
label: anger

text: We are several friends but our characters are very different andwe inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myselfdon't know what to do, I try not to hurt either of the \parties\" because there are conflicts to which one I should belong."
label: sadness

text: I stayed for several weeks with a friend of mine before she movedto live with her husband. One evening he came drunk and made anawful scene, which I still remember.
label: disgust

text: In the past I experienced this feeling almost all the time -wherever I went, in different sutuations. I was small and I hadto be taken to kindergarten, but me the fool didn't dare to tellexactly where, finally as a result I was late.
label: shame

text: My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them.But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I amto blame for not following the advise of the others, but it isnot late still.
label: guilt

text: When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be inrevenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights.Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found measleep for which he sent me to the cells.
label: anger

text: Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and formy unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six yearsof my life.
label: sadness

text: Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as afriend to some members of my family, and my niece Yavanna who'ssix was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was reallysilly and at first it was ok, but it went on and on - yukky pooh!You eat your snot, etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. Butshe had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'daccepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better -it was partly having my friend there.
label: disgust

text: In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend'sbirthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin, really wanted me to getdrunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit,but had always been very careful - brought up to believe inmoderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixeddrinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and hadto leave the table to get sick in the loo, and later went homeand was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And Ididn't want to face or tell my other flatmates, or family.
label: shame

text: I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never mymother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feelwhen we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I feltI'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid andguilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.
label: guilt

text: Can think of no time that I have felt fear.
label: fear

text: Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in acouple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who hadstayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to mydaughter.
label: anger

text: Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.
label: sadness

text: Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle -driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.
label: disgust

text: A daughter in court for staff pilfering, she was dressed like a\street walker\" - I had a friend form overseas with me and was falsely trying to impress with my family."
label: shame

text: Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter withbaseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talkconvinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing thepolice then guilty for feeling guilty about it.
label: guilt

text: I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit ofbeing late, came late again after promising to say he would be atwork in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had beendrinking.
label: anger

text: Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.
label: disgust

text: I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer whilein a position of trust.
label: guilt

text: When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and hadhamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest nightout in 20 years.
label: joy

text: While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by awoman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property -via a flooded river !
label: fear

text: 4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we wereentertaining \conservative\" relations who wanted to see the first episode."
label: disgust

text: A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderlyvisitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.
label: shame

text: I had to leave an important function early because of familycommitments. Someone else had to complete my job.
label: guilt

text: I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first stepsI took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoybeing alive.
label: joy

text: I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs,alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shutfence.
label: fear

text: I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keepgoing because it was late and I would be back in the next fewdays anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.
label: sadness

text: My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the mostexpensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drovehome and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her stateand her actions.
label: disgust

text: When I was young I stole something from a shop and got caught,then I was taken to the police station and my parents had to comeand get me.
label: guilt

text: When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), thethought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I hadthought.
label: joy

text: When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.
label: fear

text: When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learnedI had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and LiteratureNational Olympiad.
label: joy

text: When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It wasnecessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losinghim because he is so dear to me.
label: fear

text: When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies atthe Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks andin general the best records of all the candidates.
label: anger

text: When, for example, someone is calumnating.
label: disgust

text: When, for example, I fail in my undertakings.
label: shame

text: For example, when I have promised something but I haven'tfulfilled it.
label: guilt

text: Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with theworst.
label: joy

text: The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.
label: fear

text: I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.
label: anger

text: Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.
label: sadness

text: I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced thisfeeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.
label: disgust

text: I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.
label: shame

text: It happens to me quite often. I can't describe a particular case.
label: guilt

text: Realizing one's desire, an experienced feeling of satisfactionfrom the realization of one's desires and aims.
label: joy

text: Attitude to some manners of dealing and some \sanctioned\" relations."
label: anger

text: Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocentas they are when you are young.
label: sadness

text: Attitude to a related family.
label: disgust

text: Exaggerating certain circumstances, wrong attitude and evaluationof these circumstances.
label: shame

text: Low evaluation of other people's cares.
label: guilt

text: If a close relative's life is in danger.
label: fear

text: A close person lied to me.
label: anger

text: Getting separated from my girlfriend.
label: sadness

text: Encouter with a prostitute.
label: disgust

text: A theft committed by me.
label: shame

text: Lack of respect for my parents.
label: guilt

text: When my son was born.
label: joy

text: After the loss of a close relative.
label: sadness

text: I travelled on a bus and I forgot to punch the ticket. A ticketcollector came in and I had to pay the fine. I did it with a feelingof shame.
label: shame

text: I forgot to convey an important announcement.
label: guilt

text: Meeting a loved man.
label: joy

text: I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus whereI was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn'tsee the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from theside I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellowlight.
label: fear

text: When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.
label: sadness

text: At the sight of an insect, such as the black-beetle.
label: disgust

text: When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom Irespect.
label: shame

text: Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking itoff with me, i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because untilthat moment, he deliberately restricted our dates. The motiveswere brought to my knowledge later.
label: anger

text: This happens to me when I am not prepared in a given subject.
label: shame

text: When I was admitted to the University.
label: joy

text: I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almostfor a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in thehospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation Ifelt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do tome, of the unknown.
label: fear

text: Summer, heavy rain, storm - I was standing with my face stick tothe window: the childhood, something was going away forever thissummer, I was leaving my home, I was going to study in anothertown, for the first time I was leaving my parents, friends, I hadto manage myself, a long and loved period of my life was over - Iwas crying.
label: sadness

text: I saw in the street a man spitting.
label: disgust

text: I talked with a man who stammered and without controlling myself,I started to talk imitating him.
label: shame

text: When I understood that I was admitted to the University.
label: joy

text: I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had creptunder my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and ahalf.
label: fear

text: I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or aform.
label: anger

text: I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect,lied to me.
label: disgust

text: I feel shame when sometimes, (unconsciously) I behave unethicallyand without understanding the problems of the man I love.
label: shame

text: A quarrel was followed by the decision of leaving a person closeto me. Several days later my regret was great. I was besidemyself. Quite unexpectedly he came and the conflict was calmlysolved. I was glad at the possibility to be with him.
label: joy

text: One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they weretalking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what itmight mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. Ifelt it a very near and possible event.
label: fear

text: Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what Iwas the witness of, caused anger in me.
label: anger

text: The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, causeda deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.
label: sadness

text: I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of theelementary human norms.
label: disgust

text: At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. Hehad given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparisonwith the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense ofguilt.
label: guilt

text: When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.
label: joy

text: I broke my knee when I was skiing over \Yastrebetz\" (a racing track in a Bulgarian winter resort)."
label: fear

text: The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosisto my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL(A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.
label: anger

text: I felt this feeling during the exam in higher mathematics.
label: shame

text: My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead ofamidophen.
label: guilt

text: I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year ofpractice, at a contest, I covered the norms for \a master of sports\"."
label: joy

text: When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice becauseof indifference or cowardice.
label: anger

text: When I left a man in whom I really believed.
label: sadness

text: Disgust with drunk people.
label: disgust

text: When I try to lie.
label: shame

text: When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activitybetter but I had not done it because of reluctance orcarelessness.
label: guilt

text: When I was admitted to the University.
label: joy

text: When I broke my leg I felt fear.
label: fear

text: When someone lies to me.
label: anger

text: At an unjust insult or injure.
label: sadness

text: From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when Iam in a restaurant.
label: disgust

text: When I promise to do something but I don't fulfill it.
label: shame

text: When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.
label: joy

text: In a dam lake, when the water was let flow to water the plantsand I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescuedourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was withus.
label: fear

text: It was quite recently, at the football match between the nationalteams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottishreferee who ran the match quite partially.
label: anger

text: When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much andwhich I had listened before together with friends.
label: sadness

text: A striking act of ingratitude at a public vehicle.
label: disgust

text: I counterfeited a mark in the school register during the lessonin gymnastics. I felt this feeling two days later when I stoodface to face with my teacher, whom I highly appreciated andrespected.
label: shame

text: I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation inthe children Assembly.
label: joy

text: I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clocksomeone knocked violently on the door.
label: fear

text: A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but hedidn't come.
label: anger

text: I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom Igot separated an year ago and when comparing him with my presentone with whom things are not much of a success.
label: sadness

text: Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriendthen over me.
label: disgust

text: I had to prepare a report but I couldn't write it. I read from abook off-hand, I was quite uneasy and I felt I didn't manage.
label: shame

text: My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call ofmine.
label: guilt

text: Bulgaria won a football match against France.
label: joy

text: I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.
label: fear

text: I was neglected undeservedly.
label: anger

text: My grandmother died.
label: sadness

text: A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.
label: disgust

text: I didn't attend lectures.
label: guilt

text: The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I feltfear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to bein order.
label: fear

text: About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife thedue maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.
label: anger

text: Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had noidea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. Thefact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.
label: sadness

text: I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capableof, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat inthe tram.
label: disgust

text: Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight butthrough my fault. I felt strong shame because I had the spiritsof a good driver.
label: shame

text: Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.
label: guilt

text: The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son.I can say those were the happiest months in my life.
label: joy

text: A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of hisbehavior.
label: fear

text: When I encountered not only with my father's lack ofunderstanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me asa parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to beright are concerned.
label: anger

text: From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.
label: sadness

text: I was disgusted from a quarrel between two married people, inwhich the children were involved as accusers of one of theparents.
label: disgust

text: When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't takehim out to ride his byke, because I am tired.
label: guilt

text: I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twentydays.
label: joy

text: I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear wasnot quite justifiable, I still remember about it.
label: fear

text: I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times.Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would comehome but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.
label: anger

text: At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality isnot treated decently.
label: anger

text: At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).
label: sadness

text: At an unworthy behaviour of a man, pettiness, stupidity andmostly at a philistinism.
label: disgust

text: At a weakness on my part.
label: shame

text: When I was admitted to the University.
label: joy

text: Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility tointerrupt my studies.
label: fear

text: I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.
label: anger

text: At a prolonged separation with my family.
label: sadness

text: I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse ofa rat.
label: disgust

text: I feel this feeling at one and the same degree when I am notprepared to overcome certain obstacle in my life.
label: shame

text: I offended a person who had done much for me and who had helpedme for everything.
label: guilt

text: The day when my son said for the first time \mummy\"."
label: joy

text: Before an exam in logics.
label: fear

text: My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours thenwe got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had torefuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked myanger.
label: anger

text: My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothershaving walks with their children.
label: sadness

text: The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond tomy norms of behaviour.
label: disgust

text: I was to take part in a cocktail party on the occasion of ournational holiday as a servant.
label: shame

text: I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.
label: guilt

text: The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression,as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude thesituative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it'sout of me.
label: joy

text: A honest \sliding\" on the part of a girlfriend of mine. Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books."
label: anger

text: Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial\explanation\"."
label: sadness

text: A lie on the part of a person close to me.
label: disgust

text: I feel this feeling most often before me not before the others.My outside is iron but actually I'm wasting away.
label: guilt

text: My son was born.
label: joy

text: I had a car accident.
label: fear

text: I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the trafficordinance. In fact I was innocent.
label: anger

text: I lost a close friend.
label: sadness

text: I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war.After the film I felt disgust.
label: disgust

text: I was nailed. I lied in connection with a book which I took fromthe library, because I had to keep it for a longer time.
label: shame

text: I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. Myfriend relied on them.
label: guilt

text: After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes Ipassed my last exam.
label: joy

text: Before going to the dentist.
label: fear

text: When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I wastemy time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociologicalinvestigation and then I got really angry.
label: anger

text: When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - butI am alone.
label: sadness

text: I am ashamed when I am not ready for my seminar in internaldiseases, simply because the assistant professor is a person whodeserves high respect.
label: shame

text: When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this oftenhappenes.
label: joy

text: When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a personwith a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.
label: fear

text: I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant,since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.
label: anger

text: It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.
label: sadness

text: I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look likenormal people.
label: disgust

text: I was totally unprepared for a seminar conducted by an assistantprofessor whom I highly respect.
label: shame

text: I got back too late after a Sunday going out without havingcalled up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept thewhole night.
label: guilt

text: I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.
label: fear

text: I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecentwords.
label: anger

text: I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elderpeople to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal ormoral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour ofmine made me kick out my guests because they had talked veryloudly and threatened that with \connections\" she will expel me from the inst."
label: disgust

text: I experienced long ago when I was sightseeing Bulgarians in aforeign language.
label: shame

text: My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blamebacause with her it is a stress disease.
label: guilt

text: When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.
label: joy

text: One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story, nobodytook it seriously but I got frightened.
label: fear

text: I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinentlyand immorally
label: anger

text: When I failed at the first entrance exam.
label: sadness

text: Once I was not ready for a seminar and I was asked to leave.
label: shame

text: I felt guilty when once I made my mother angry.
label: guilt

text: Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom Itrusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendlyfeelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and inour fate.
label: joy

text: Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected withunexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evokedin me many negative emotions.
label: fear

text: I always get angry when somebody deceives me, or tries to concealhis lie skilfully and this offends me even more.
label: anger

text: Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very oftenrecently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe mygeneral impression from severl situations which evoked thisfeeling in me.
label: sadness

text: I didn't keep a promise I had made to a man, and in this way Ilost his esteem and confidence in me. I caused him a lot oftrouble.
label: guilt

text: When I was accepted as a student.
label: joy

text: I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was somethingwrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was notserious and I need not worry.
label: fear

text: For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - whenI don't see her even for two or three days.
label: sadness

text: For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening, andwho behaved impudently with the girls standing by.
label: disgust

text: I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed withmyself - how little I knew and how good was the examinor. Irarely become ashamed.
label: shame

text: I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I wasnot afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relievethe pains of a patient.
label: joy

text: Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I sawanother one, as if out of control of the driver.
label: fear

text: Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.
label: sadness

text: I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street.I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.
label: disgust

text: I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her mylecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so thegirl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.
label: guilt

text: When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.
label: joy

text: Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes meafraid.
label: fear

text: The loss of a person I loved very much.
label: sadness

text: Deception from a person I loved very much.
label: disgust

text: I was very happy when I got the message that I had been acceptedas a student in medicine.
label: joy

text: I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man onthe terrace of the flat.
label: fear

text: I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare forthe term examinations.
label: anger

text: I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent wordsat a man without any reason whatsoever.
label: disgust

text: At an exam in pharmacology I tried to prompt a coleague (sheasked me something) and the assistant professor made me a sharpremark.
label: shame

text: My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I stillhaven't had time to see her.
label: guilt

text: Some time ago I was disgusted with the \cleanness\" of the refectory of our institute."
label: disgust

text: We were at a football match and when we were leaving the stadium(the stadium was packed with people) and I lost my shoe in thecrowd. Our attempts to find it didn't give any result and I hadto go home without one shoe. In other words to cross the wholetown !
label: shame

text: When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with manypeople about my applying for this institute and I decided toprove that one can pass excellently without visiting anypreparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.
label: joy

text: Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn'twanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness(and so it is now).
label: fear

text: A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the onewho was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and toldthe truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call andthreatened me.
label: anger

text: Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for everyschool-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we lefteach other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even nowI remember about it quite often.
label: sadness

text: It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were tograduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feeldisgusted.
label: disgust

text: I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, mycoevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreignfriends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then weroused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. Ididn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.
label: shame

text: When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in ourmark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from myclassmates about the scolding they had got at home. My firstmark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for morethan that and I put down \very good\" for fear of being scolded. Naturally my parents guessed all about it. They rebuked me for what I had done."
label: guilt

text: When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most -floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the generalone).
label: joy

text: I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it anddirected towards me. I was quite near the house wall when itrolled by and hit me.
label: fear

text: My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistancemovement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost hishealth. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid thenurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how oldhe was (79).
label: anger

text: My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when wehad to get separated again.
label: sadness

text: I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was wellprepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and Icouldn't answer.
label: shame

text: I had undertaken to help my sister for her class work but someunexpected circumstances prevented me from doing that.
label: guilt

text: I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heardabout it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.
label: joy

text: I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeasedto hear that my roommates had talked about it and they hadmisrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned thatit was done by a \good\" acquaintance of mine."
label: anger

text: When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let himunderstand I felt miserable.
label: sadness

text: I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into myaffairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as ifnothing had happened.
label: disgust

text: I feel shame when I have made a promise, I can't keep it and thishas negative effects which are caused by my behavior.
label: shame

text: I felt it when I came home after the examination session and Isaid I had not passed my last exam.
label: guilt

text: I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistryexamination.
label: joy

text: This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to studythere. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distancePlovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.
label: fear

text: I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently,the pedology lecturer was the cause.
label: anger

text: This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a caraccident.
label: sadness

text: I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car wouldrun over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.
label: disgust

text: I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.
label: shame

text: The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted mystudies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! Theybelieved in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.
label: guilt

text: Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigueduty as a soldier.
label: fear

text: I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts ofquarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering hisliving close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.
label: disgust

text: Some time ago I promised to meet an acquaintance of mine and tocarry him some promised papers. I haven't done it until this day.Now I feel quite awkward when I meet him.
label: shame

text: After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and hadgot a high mark. When you present someone with something and hefeels glad.
label: joy

text: Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entranceexaminations.
label: fear

text: I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to bepresent at an event and to stay partial to what happens.
label: anger

text: When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad formy early years, for the freedom and the carefree years ofchildhood.
label: sadness

text: I feel disgusted with the bootlickers, with helpless people.
label: disgust

text: I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.
label: shame

text: I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some dayslater he died.
label: guilt

text: I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excitedbecause it was a supplementary examination. I passed the examvery well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.
label: joy

text: Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinationsmost of all. I remember I was horror stricken before mymicrobiology exam, because it was a decisive one.
label: fear

text: It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with acelebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turnedout that there was no audience at all because everyone hadpretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I gotfurious.
label: anger

text: In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quiteintelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearestfuture. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because Icouldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear themthreatening me they would throw our my things. And at that myluggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I wasquitedisappointed and disgusted.
label: disgust

text: During our last exarcise in agricultural machines we went out inthe yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to havefulfilled our task well, because when our teacher came and askedme a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because hedidn't deserve it.
label: shame

text: I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. Ifelt guilty before her.
label: guilt

text: When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is nowmy girlfriend).
label: joy

text: I fear before each exam.
label: fear

text: When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.
label: anger

text: When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.
label: sadness

text: When I wasn't well prepared for a terminal exam and the teachertried to give me a three by asking me some very easy questions. Iburned with shame then.
label: shame

text: When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at homebecause she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by aman. But it remained undone.
label: guilt

text: I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was inFebruary.
label: joy

text: It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunkand one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol.I felt fear of what could have happened.
label: fear

text: I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but ithappened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I thinkI can call it so.
label: sadness

text: I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on himbut he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.
label: disgust

text: Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit aparty where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On thenext day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had saidand done on the night before.
label: shame

text: Last year I put off an exam for the autumn session withoutknowing if there was a supplementary examination session. When Icame home with my exam unpassed I felt guilty before my parentswhen I remembered how much they had done for me.
label: guilt

text: When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.
label: joy

text: I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and Icould not feel it at all.
label: fear

text: I felt disgust with alcohol in general when a close friend ofmine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and itwas quite shameful.
label: disgust

text: I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceivedthem.
label: shame

text: I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accidentbut as my parents did not know who was to blame, they punished mybrother because I had no driving licence and they thought itimpossible that had driven the car.
label: guilt

text: I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher AgriculturalInstitute.
label: joy

text: That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unrealmarks.
label: anger

text: I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that somethinghad irrevocably gone away from me.
label: sadness

text: I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, tointerrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a classwith her in our first year.
label: disgust

text: That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then wascought.
label: shame

text: I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had hadenough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.
label: guilt

text: I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time mysister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened thetelegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.
label: joy

text: It was some years ago when one evening some people came home andtold us my father was badly injured in an accident.
label: fear

text: I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to theinstitute in the first classifying, in spite of the high mark Ihad got at the entrance examination.
label: anger

text: Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from myhome town.
label: sadness

text: I feel disgust with my first boyfriend who made fun of our lovein an abominable way.
label: disgust

text: I have always felt ashamed for some people's behavior to theirtoo old parents. I have felt hurt and shy when they have leftthem to the mercy of fate.
label: shame

text: I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and haveto tell them I have failed an exam.
label: guilt

text: Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my secondbirthday.
label: joy

text: When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.
label: fear

text: A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experiencedthis feeling when I tried to chase her out.
label: anger

text: After my father's death.
label: sadness

text: With an alcoholic.
label: disgust

text: Once I had dinner at an elegant restaurant and I did not haveenough money to pay the bill. There were a lot of people thereand I felt quite awkward.
label: shame

text: Something very unpleasant happened when I was a soldier and I wasdirectly involved in it.
label: guilt

text: I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill fora long period, my father came back home.
label: joy

text: I took part in a football match. The referee was extremelypartial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent andanger.
label: anger

text: When my first girlfriend an I left each other.
label: sadness

text: During a summer holiday at a bar I happened to see a dead to theworld woman.
label: disgust

text: When I first had a sexual intercourse.
label: shame

text: I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner setquite involuntarily.
label: guilt

text: When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivatedteacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quiteundeservedly.
label: anger

text: When I got separated from my first love.
label: sadness

text: Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreatedphysically me and my mother.
label: disgust

text: When at times unconscienciously I speak to my mother in a hightome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.
label: guilt

text: Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. Hetelephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
label: joy

text: Watching a horror movie with friends.
label: fear

text: The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sadthen angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.
label: anger

text: The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She wasof my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as wellas her family etc.
label: sadness

text: Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated otherpeople similarly - including lying, hiding facts, beingdeceitful, unfair, etc.
label: disgust

text: Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yellingand screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - ineffect lowering myself to their level.
label: shame

text: Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospitalafter her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.
label: guilt

text: Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. Shewasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinkingofleaving the job only after 2 days employment.
label: joy

text: Walking home at night after university - part of the way, thereare ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with thethouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.
label: fear

text: When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that heknows needs doing.
label: anger

text: When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her motherwho had passed away about a month ago.
label: sadness

text: With a woman who had walked into my place of employment andurinated on the floor in front of everyone.
label: disgust

text: Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat veryclose to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.
label: joy

text: I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibateand alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibitedsexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fearthrough lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelingsdespite my own being hurt in the process.
label: fear

text: In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members ofsociety for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids byPolice (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just areflection of my own shortcomings.
label: anger

text: Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square.Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. Iwent into the role of a performing clown.
label: sadness

text: I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself, myhomework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention.Especially in learning another language.
label: disgust

text: I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially myparent father, shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceivedself-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself asI am.
label: shame

text: I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guiltyat being a student when other people were not. Guilt about beinga potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid thisemotion)
label: guilt

text: When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doingwell - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'dtaught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid forCouncil.
label: joy

text: A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were notas neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - Sheimplied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time,and taking 3 University exams part time).
label: anger

text: When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attackedme verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discardedbecause his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgustsaddned me.
label: sadness

text: Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual familyfriends dinner. Told \Not to Speak\". The attitude by him was negative/I was in mid 20s, I had done many things - a wide range of experiences. Probably greater than he."
label: shame

text: Not attending school, whenam not sick - but in need of mentalrest. Staff on your return query your \sickness\" - it is easier in N.Z. to be sick, rather than confide other personal reasons etc."
label: guilt

text: My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.
label: joy

text: A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving asmall Lazer).
label: fear

text: A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before Decemberlast year.
label: anger

text: My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - \Lord Grey\" died in his sleep - His death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought."
label: sadness

text: A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.
label: disgust

text: I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did notaccept my Visa !
label: shame

text: When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.
label: guilt

text: When my daughter was born.
label: joy

text: When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. Ifelt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.
label: fear

text: When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving.We had made a pact the other would not drink and so thereforewould be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at thetime.
label: anger

text: When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.
label: sadness

text: When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed witha rugby tour of South Africa.
label: disgust

text: When I was unable to respond to a welcome in my indigenouslanguage of Maori at an important function where I was the onlywoman in the group and it was expected of me.
label: shame

text: When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an importantfamily occasion that I should not have missed.
label: guilt

text: Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5years, at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the\paper work\" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming through the customs gate."
label: joy

text: After I had managed to fail my first year at University I wasscared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't wanta mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my waythrough an unsubsidized year at university to settle down andcontinue my studies.
label: fear

text: When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years,had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has beenquite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makesme feel really sad.
label: sadness

text: A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded toshow pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most peoplehad had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading,unmoral manner - especially females exposing and flauntingthemselves with no shame or embarassment.
label: disgust

text: Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I beganto feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it wasonly \the thing to do\", and not really an act of love."
label: shame

text: This feeling of guilt really applies to moral/religious views. I(being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe inand had a sexual relationship with my boyfriend. Many monthslater, when I was doing some deeper self analysis I began to feelguilty and realized that I had gone against what I wanted formyself and my future.
label: guilt

text: My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anywayif I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back Istart thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and areperhaps dead.
label: fear

text: Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organisea roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn atdoing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can'tbe bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.
label: anger

text: So as to be closer to the university I have left home and movedinto Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especiallymy family - forever.
label: sadness

text: A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him butis quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.
label: disgust

text: NO RESPONSE.
label: shame

text: When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had toback up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was onlyabout 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.
label: fear

text: When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2yrs after I took her to the doctor at the age of 1 and hediagnosed it.
label: sadness

text: My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat meverbally.
label: disgust

text: When I had to go to reconciliation before converting toCatholicism but then once received - o.k.
label: guilt

text: I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at asocial one night, which one of my relative was involved. My fearwas greatly for him because he was being assaulted badly.
label: fear

text: Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.
label: anger

text: This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish ourrelationship due to some circumstances between her and herfamily. I was really sad, hurt and couldn't really find anyreason why am I still living. Is this life is all about ? Thiswas one of few question which crept up vividly every time Ithought about what had happened.
label: sadness

text: I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body withdrugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usuallyfor an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they dothings stupidly and unjustly.
label: disgust

text: NO RESPONSE.
label: shame

text: Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e., ill feeling.
label: joy

text: Had fear of losing husband.
label: fear

text: When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self -to leave her son alone - as she did not want me for a futuredaughter-in-law.
label: anger

text: When boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.
label: sadness

text: Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering,over-protecting and selfish attitudes.
label: disgust

text: When ditched - divorced by husband.
label: shame

text: When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of agroup.
label: guilt

text: My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made reallyhappy because I was adopted into the family and her asking memade me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just anotherperson. There were other cousins she could have asked but sheasked me.
label: joy

text: That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from myMum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 anddidn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adoptedat 14.
label: fear

text: My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until twodays after.
label: sadness

text: A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father.I only knew the child and had not come into contact with eitherparent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event andthe stepfather disgusted me.
label: disgust

text: I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring tofind out and I had to tell her I had lied.
label: guilt

text: Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.
label: joy

label: joy

label: fear

text: When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd diedbecause she was old, but because she lived in the last few yearsin an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers -no chair, or private space, and when I went to visit she would besitting in the \lliving\" room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I felt awkward so I didn't go and I was sad 'cos how I couldn't."
label: sadness

label: joy

AndI was quite jealous - later on the photographer decided not totake her photograph, and she was very upset - I felt guilty as aresult, almost as if I had caused her to lose her opportunity, bynot being genuinely happy for her in the first place.

label: fear

text: I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talkabout it and my feelings, the consequence with my parents. Theytry to repress it.
